column5: I think "you" means just you. READ THIS AGREEMENT BEFORE DOWNLOADING THIS NAVIONICS® PRODUCT. THIS IS A NON EXCLUSIVE LICENSE AGREEMENT BETWEEN YOU AND NAVIONICS. BY DOWNLOADING THIS NAVIONICS® PRODUCT, YOU ARE CONSENTING TO THE TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT. YOU MAY NOT PROCEED TO PURCHASE OR USE THE PRODUCT UNLESS YOU FIRST AGREE, AFFIRMATIVELY INDICATING YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THIS AGREEMENT. CERTAIN DEFINITIONS: As used in this Agreement, the following terms have the respective meanings provided below: DEVICE means any or all of the hardware devices on which you access or use the Product, including without limitation a computer, tablet, smartphone or plotter. NAVIONICS means: (a) if you live in the Americas (including Caribbean countries and any territories or possessions of countries in the Americas), Navionics Inc., a Delaware, USA, corporation having its principal place of business at 6 Thatcher Lane, Wareham 02571, Massachusetts, USA; or (b) if you live anywhere else, Navionics S.p.A., an Italian company, with head office at Corso Magenta 43, 20122 Milan, Italy, Fiscal Code and Register of Enterprises of Milan No. 00260950456, V.A.T. number No. 01661250462. PRODUCT means a Navionics® electronic chart product containing cartographic, touristic and similar information, and related application software, downloaded electronically from Navionics ChartInstaller, or an app installed on a mobile Device. SONARCHARTS means a high definition bathymetry map layer created by integrating hydrographic office charts with data from Navionics proprietary surveys and sonar logs provided by Navionics Community users COMMUNITY EDITS means edits made by Navionics users using Navionics apps and viewable on select chartplotters and on apps. USES PERMITTED: You may use your Product on your Device as an electronic chart/map and ancillary aid to navigation (see Safety Warning below). This Agreement gives you certain limited rights to use and maintain the Product. You agree to use reasonable efforts to protect the Product from unauthorized use, reproduction, distribution or publication. In the case of Products used on mobile Devices, Navionics reserves the rights to take marketing initiatives, by itself or through co-marketing actions, by sending messages or causing banners to appear on your Device during use of the Product (you may opt out of such initiatives by sending an empty e-mail from the e-mail account to which the Product is registered to [email protected]). PROHIBITED USES: You may not (1) make copies of a Product; (2) alter, decompile, disassemble or reverse-engineer or attempt to unlock or bypass the initialization system or encryption techniques utilized with, a Product; or (3) remove or obscure Navionics copyright or trademark notices from any Product (or its physical media, if applicable). Community Layers: As used herein, Community Layers (CL) means any data submitted by any user of Products, using an interface included in a Product or on Navionics website, and shared with Navionics and the Navionics Community. CL may be more than one and include in separate layers and without limitation: Community Edits, SonarCharts, sonar logs, points of interest (POI) and other cartographic object additions, bathy information, error fixing or discrepancy reports. CL may be submitted only to correct or improve Navionics' charts and may not include any personal data unless specifically and formally authorized by you. Your submission and use of CL is subject to applicable terms, rules of conduct and copyright policies set forth in the Terms of Use posted on Navionics website <http://www.navionics.com/terms-use >. In Sweden, sonar logs may only be recorded in inland waters. Restrictions might also apply in Norway, Finland and Denmark. Please comply with local laws. Navionics may change such rules and policies at any time without notice to you and your submission of CL shall constitute your acceptance of such rules and policies as are then in effect. Accordingly, you should review the Terms of Use from time to time for any changes. DURATION & TERMINATION: This Agreement is effective from the day you download or otherwise purchase your Product and shall continue until terminated. Your license to use Data shall terminate automatically, without notice from Navionics, if you fail to comply with any provision of this Agreement. Upon such termination, you must delete and destroy any Product in your possession or control. Navionics reserves the right to enforce any other legal rights arising from termination. Navionics is not obligated to support superseded or discontinued versions of Products or to upgrade or maintain Products for use on new releases/versions of your Device or its operating system. Some or all features of your Product may fail to function on Devices other then the Device for which you originally purchased it. DISCLAIMER: THE PRODUCT AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE LICENSED AS IS AND NAVIONICS (AND ITS AFFILIATES, CONTRACTORS, EMPLOYEES, DEVELOPERS, CLIENTS, AGENTS, SUPPLIERS, OR THIRD-PARTY PARTNERS) DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. YOU ASSUME THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO THE PERFORMANCE AND RESULTS OF PRODUCT. NAVIONICS'S CUMULATIVE LIABILITY TO YOU OR ANY OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGES RESULTING FROM ANY CLAIMS, DEMANDS, OR ACTIONS ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT SHALL NOT EXCEED THE PURCHASE PRICE YOU PAID FOR THE LICENSE TO USE THE PRODUCT. IN NO EVENT SHALL NAVIONICS BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, SPECIAL, OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES OR LOST PROFITS, EVEN IF NAVIONICS HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. SOME JURISDICTIONS DO NOT ALLOW THE LIMITATION OR EXCLUSION OF LIABILITY FOR INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, SO THE FOREGOING LIMITATION OR EXCLUSION MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU. GENERAL: If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of this Agreement shall not be affected thereby and such provision shall be substituted with a valid and enforceable provision which as nearly as possible accomplishes the intent of the original provision. This Agreement shall be governed by the following laws (Applicable Law), without reference to conflict-of-law principles, and any dispute arising out or relating to this Agreement shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the following courts: (a) if your licensor is Navionics Inc., the laws of Massachusetts, USA and the state courts sitting in Plymouth County, or the federal courts sitting in Boston, Massachusetts, USA; or (b) if your licensor is Navionics S.p.A., the laws of Italy and the Court of Milan, Italy. The foregoing choices of law and forum are subject to mandatory (non-waivable) provisions of (i) Applicable Law; or (ii) of the jurisdiction in which you reside. SAFETY WARNINGS: Products are designed to provide ancillary aid to navigation by facilitating the use of authorized government charts, not to replace such charts. Only official government charts and notices to mariners contain all information needed for safe navigation. The user is responsible for the prudent use of Products. Any routes generated by electronic charts, auto-routing software or similar tools are basic suggestions for route planning only and must not be used for direct navigation. IF YOU ARE PURCHASING THIS PRODUCT THROUGH iTUNES: You acknowledge and agree that (i) this Agreement is concluded between you and Navionics, and not Apple, Inc. (Apple); (ii) Navionics, and not Apple, is solely responsible for the Product; (iii) Apple has no responsibility whatsoever to furnish any maintenance and support services with respect to the Product; (iv) in the event of any failure of the Product to conform to any applicable warranty, you may notify Apple and Apple will refund the purchase price you paid for the Product; (v) to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, Apple will have no other warranty obligation whatsoever with respect to the Product; (vi) Apple is not responsible for any claims that you have arising out of your use of the Product; (vii) Apple will have no responsibility whatsoever for the investigation, defense, settlement or discharge of any third-party claim that the Product infringes that third party's intellectual property rights; and (viii) Apple and its subsidiaries are third-party beneficiaries of this Agreement and, upon your acceptance of this Agreement, Apple will have the right (and will be deemed to have accepted the right) to enforce this Agreement against you as a third-party beneficiary. You represent and warrant that: (i) you are not located in a country that is subject to a U.S. Government embargo, or that has been designated by the U.S. Government as a terrorist supporting country; and (ii) you are not listed on any U.S. Government list of prohibited or restricted parties. END-USER TERMS REQUIRED BY FLURRY SERVICES: Navionics is using in its mobile applications Flurry Services in order to collect statistical data about your usage of our applications, without infringing your privacy rights. Above data are used to improve the services offered to you. Flurry is not responsible for any use by Navionics of any data about you. If you do not want Flurry to track data from your device you can opt-out by clicking on this link: http://www.flurry.com/resources/privacy.html 15/07/2013 ABOUT NAVIONICS Company Foundation Contact us Careers: hiring NOW! Lowrance owns the insight maps that can be used on their units.
Yeah a couple years ago, hummingbird purchased lakemaster. So, lowrance started producing their own chips (or purchased a company to do it under the lowrance name)
Lowrance is not a downloadable chip, so that might be different. Also, rentals is not in the "prohibited uses". Reproduction and copys/redistribution are banned of course.
I don't want to sound like a scrooge, but your guests/lessees would not have license and your license is limited to your use.
We will see. I don't think it's an issue. If the license was limited to "my" use, then it'd actually be illegal to loan it to a friend. Since they technically hadn't paid for it.
LOW1, if your perspective is accurate, wouldn't that prohibit selling chips in the secondary market as well?

Yes. Whether the maker of the cheap feels it is worthwhile to pursue the matter in that scenario is another issue. I suspect that the manufacturer is more likely to address situations where the chip is rented, but that's a business decision.

I suppose I'll summarize my thoughts this way - from the legal perspective I don't agree with your assessment, but another interesting and relevant question is - would it be ethical? If someone wanted to work out a chip rental business, the right thing to do would be to have a discussion with the company and work out a mutually beneficial deal.

Ok... got an email back from Lowrance. Renting CHIPS is not against any rules. Not a very descriptive email, but it works. "Hi Jared, Yes, it is ok to rent the chips. Thank you for choosing Lowrance! Donna"

I didn't think there'd be anything wrong with it. It kind of seems like the old movie rental stores (before Netflix and online). They bought the movies outright, and made their own profit off of their initial purchase investment. If you want to purchase enough mapping chips to supply the demand for map chip rentals, and the risk of losing them occasionally, then more power to you. Like any rental business, you have the large cost of purchasing several chips upfront, and it will take XX number of rentals before profit kicks in.
Does Lowrance make any map chips? I thought Navionics and Lakemaster were the main two players in this field.

James Morris I have no idea what you are talking about . If I produced a GPS chip and sold it I would be real upset if you rented my chip out if that was against our sales agreement. I am after all a principled Curmudgeon.
But wait; There's more!! For a limited time we'll also include a second chip. Just pay extra shipping and handling...

I'm not sure that it would be against any sales agreement. As a camp owner, I'm allowed to rent things (boats, gps units, depth finders, trolling motors). These companies happily sell to me, knowing I will be making a profit off of their equipment. As long as you don't reproduce the chip, I can't imagine the chip being any different than the other items mentioned.
I'm not sure how it is much different than a movie rental? Or tool rental. Or anything else for thar matter.

It depends on the licensing agreement. If you rent out the chip are you sending royalty checks to Navionics? Netflix pays a small royalty every time you watch something, I don't think tool rental pays royalties. Can you buy a single chip and then load it on 10 different sonars among your friends? The new SonarCharts program is taking advantage of crowd sourcing to build detail but you pay to sign on to that. An outfitter who has bought ten units to put on ten boats is doing as much or more advertising as he is "renting" the units and he could use that crowd sourcing of the lake very much to his advantage. Just imagine the detail you would get from the logs of ten boats fishing the same lake everyday for a season. I would carefully read the agreement before building any sort of business model based on rental.

Technically, if it's illegal to rent the chips, then it is illegal to have them in rented equipment. Meaning, any boat that a resort owns, could not have a lake chip in it. Simply because that would be the equivalent of renting it. The more I think this through the more certain I am that there is no legal issues with renting the chips. The chips we have are not downloadable. So, it is one unit for one chip.
What plotter do you have now? Do you fish in the US and do you have a chip now? If so what chip?
There's your answer^ Read the fine print. You can't rent your Word program either. And they may be watching you.
I sent lowrance a detailed email asking if units and corresponding maps are allowed to be rented.

Has anyone ever seen this or thought of doing it? I am looking to go to Canada for the first time and am starting to look at map chips. I dont know when I will every go back to Canada if I do go, so the $100-$150 chips seems like a reach for me. In the back of my head I was thinking a guy could buy a couple chips and rent them to the non-annual Canada guys like me, to basically pay for theirs. Now I understand there are license agreements with everything these days, so I don want to get into a debate over legallity of actually doing this. But it does seem like a good idea. (Remember me when you are making millions doing this)
If you come to our camp. We have gps units with the chip already installed. They are hummingbird 788's and come as standard equipment on all of our camp boats.
I think you can buy ad space on this site Tamarac.
Far be it from me to be the "ethical policeman" but renting the chip rather than buying it just doesn't seem right. Buy the chip,use it,if you don't go back to Canada,sell it.
It's only a half ad. For a full ad they would need to include phone number and web address.

You could follow the infomercial models.FREE GPS chip, just pay $15 per week shipping & handling. Then mail it in a .49 envelope with a pre-paid return envelope included. Take a credit card only for the transaction with a automatic $150.00 charge after 2 weeks.
I'm not sure what model you have, but I know that Lowrance chips have lots of different lakes (including Lake of the Woods)
Are there any good maps for the smaller lakes in NW Ontario? I fish Cedar, Cliff, Perrault, and Wabaskang. If there are good chips available for these, I'd buy one. Are there?

In practice, that's not much different than renting the chip if you view the purchase as a "deposit" of the value of the chip and the money from the sale as a return of the deposit less a sum for the use of the chip. Only one unit can access the data at a time. If someone was talking about copying / redistributing data, that is another story all together.

if the cost of a lake chip is causing you to put off your trip, I would suggest that you shouldn't be coming to Canada with such a tight budget.What I did, I purchased last seasons chip at Cabelas for $50 less than the current years chip. works just fine and has my lake on it so i'm set for the seasons to come.
